column4: odd, stupid question... im very new to programming, i know javascript fairly well but im looking to learn basic computer programming, what is the simplest language i can start off with, i need it to do basic computations and basic user graphical interface, with the ability to be compiled into a linux or windows program
Check out python.  diveintopython.org and theres a tutorial on python.org too
i thought python was a web based language
about a third of the stuff in Ubuntu is held together with python
awesome, ill take a look and see if it will work
top is already available on your install
What information are you trying to get?
try ps aux instead of top.
You can grep that (ps aux | grep foo) to just return lines with foo in it.
what process are you looking for?
That'll give you all of your gnome-terminals, in a pager, so you can scroll through them
You'd remove the file's write permissions, but keep write permissions on the folder.
Everytime you created a new file.
TCP, and #ubuntu-offtopic is probably the place for those sorts of questions in the future.
